intro: Einadia allanii, commonly known as the Allan's flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, pleasant fragrance when crushed, contributing to its ecological and horticultural significance.
